description:
As the Director of Partner Engineering for Wear, you'll be responsible for the strategy and global team that delivers the Wear OS platform on partners’ devices. From helping new partners join the ecosystem and creating a device project plan to launching and updating wearable devices, the Wear Partner Engineering team is deeply involved in the full product lifecycle of a wearable device. You will be part of the Wear Leadership team, working closely with Product Management, Engineering, and Business Leads to align on shared goals for the platform. Your technical and industry insights will influence the platform and product direction.

Whether working with next-gen chipset manufacturers or emerging market telcos, Google's Android Partner Engineering team helps solve some of the toughest mobile technology problems. We work with teams throughout Google to develop solutions for strategic partners around the globe. We maintain crucial relationships with and build technical solutions for our long-term partners who are making Android into a world-changing platform. But we're just getting started.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience across Engineering, Product Management, Technology Development and partnerships in relevant domains.
  • Technical experience working with Android, embedded systems or other OS’s used in the wearable industry.
  • Experience managing distributed technical teams.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge and understanding of the Wearable Industry.
  • Experience leading a team that has shipped or contributed to an Android-based and wearable product.
responsibilities:
• Define and deliver strategy for high-quality and updatable wearable devices running the Wear OS platform.
  • Build and lead a global team of technical leads and individual contributors who can deliver on the strategy.
  • Manage a team of technical staff to achieve strategic goals, and guide individual career growth.
title: Director, Android Partner Engineering, Wear
